title: Display
custom_expected:
1. background image is black and white
2. at the top there is flashing neon logo
3. 'Log in with MLB' button
4. 'Don't have an account? Sign Up' link

![](index.php?/attachments/get/8520268)

custom_steps_separated.content: After user installs the app for the first time
custom_steps_separated.expected: The Welcome page should not have a BETMGM logo

custom_steps_separated.content: After user created an account and logs out - if user is under 21
custom_steps_separated.expected: The Welcome page should not have a BETMGM logo

custom_steps_separated.content: After user created an account and logs out - if user is 21 or older
custom_steps_separated.expected: The Welcome page should not have a BETMGM logo

custom_steps_separated.content: After user created an account and closes the app - if user is over 21
custom_steps_separated.expected: The Welcome page should not have a BETMGM logo

custom_steps_separated.content: **Update: MGM logo should not be displayed on Welcome page for any users**

title: Display
custom_expected:
1. The words “Log In” should appear centered in the header
2. And there should be a back arrow in the top left corner
3. And there should be the words “Log in to your MLB.com account to play the game and get access to exclusive MLB content.” below the title
4. And there should be an email text field with “john.doe@email.com” as default
5. And there should be a password field with “*******” as default
6. And there should be a forgot your password link
7. And there should be a greyed out Login button
8. And there should be a Sign Up link if you don’t have an account


![](index.php?/attachments/get/34135)

9. After user puts in all information, Log In button is enabled

![](index.php?/attachments/get/34136)

title: Error message for incorrect email/password
custom_steps: When user logs in with incorrect email/password
custom_expected: 'Please enter a valid email/password' error message is displayed.

title: Forgot your password
custom_expected: Then user should be presented with a webview to reset their password

title: MLB Account Password Reset
custom_preconds: Given: "A password reset link has been sent to you via email" message has displayed
custom_steps:
When the user navigates to his/her email inbox
And opens the "MLB Account Password
Reset" email
And taps the "Reset Password" button in the body of the email
custom_expected:
Then the "Reset your password" screen opens
And a "New password" field displays
And a "Repeat password" field is present

title: Enter new password
custom_preconds: Given: User has entered a valid password in the "New password" and "Repeat password" fields
custom_steps: When the user taps the "Save" button
custom_expected: Then the user is redirected to the MLB App

title: Display
custom_expected:
1. The words “Sign Up” should be centered in the header
2. And there should be a back arrow in the top left corner
3. And the words “Create an MLB.com account to play the game and get access to exclusive MLB content.” appears just beneath the header
4. And there should be an email text field with “john.doe@email.com” as default
5. And there should be a Nickname text field with “Baseballfan2020” as default
6. And there should be a password field with “*******” as default
7. And there should be a Birthdate text field with “MM/DD/YYYY” as default
8. And there should be a greyed out sign up button
9. And there should be a Log in link if you already have an account

![](index.php?/attachments/get/34134)

10. After entering the information in all the fields, the Sign Up button becomes blue and active

custom_steps_separated.content: When user enters an Invalid email
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the line is turned red with the text “Please enter a valid email address”

custom_steps_separated.content: When user puts the space
custom_steps_separated.expected: The error message appears: 'The first character must be a letter or number'

custom_steps_separated.content:
When user enters a valid email

valid emails include:

user@gmail.com
user+@gmail.com
user-@gmail.com
user?@gmail.com
user=/-+@gmail.com
user%20@gmail.com
andi2019p@mlb.com
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the field accepts the email and throws no error message

custom_steps_separated.content: When user enters an existing email and fills the rest of the fields and click sign up
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then user should be prompted with an error message saying “An account with that email already exists”

custom_steps_separated.content: The nickname criteria are
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. nicknames should not be unique
2. must be 6-15 characters long
3. must contain only letters and numbers 
4. can not contain spaces and special characters
5. can not contain non-English characters 
6. can not be disruptive or offensive
7. can not contain emoji

custom_steps_separated.content: If the nickname has <6 and >15 characters
custom_steps_separated.expected: the error message is displayed 'Nickname must be 6-15 characters long'

custom_steps_separated.content: If the nickname contains special characters
custom_steps_separated.expected: the error message is displayed 'Nickname must contain only letters and numbers'

custom_steps_separated.content: If the nickname disruptive or offensive
custom_steps_separated.expected: the error message is displayed: 'Please choose another nickname'

title: Password field
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is on the Sign Up Page

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user is creating a password
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user will see the following password requirements and must make a password fitting the following password requirements:
 - No special characters
 - One number
 - One uppercase letter
 - One lowercase letter
 - 8-15 characters

custom_steps_separated.content: When user enters an invalid password
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the corresponding issues with the password should be red with an X in the requirements field

![](index.php?/attachments/get/34150)

custom_steps_separated.content: When user enters a valid password
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then all the password requirements should have a check mark next to them

custom_steps_separated.content: When user clicks the eyeball after entering a password
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the text in the password field should become visible
DOB format should be mm/dd/yyyy

custom_steps_separated.content: When user enters a future birthdate
custom_steps_separated.expected: “Please enter a correct birthdate” message is displayed

custom_steps_separated.content: When user enters an invalid birthdate
custom_steps_separated.expected: “Please enter your birthday in the format mm/dd/yyyy” message is displayed

custom_steps_separated.content: When user enters a birthday which is under 21
custom_steps_separated.expected:
This page pops up 

![](index.php?/attachments/get/8519354)

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user creates an account on their birthday
custom_steps_separated.expected: There should be a message stating "Happy Birthday!"

title: First time registration
custom_preconds: App is installed and the user has not registered

custom_steps_separated.content: Open the app
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. the loading page is displayed
2. Log in/Sign up page is displayed

custom_steps_separated.content: Tap Sign Up
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Things are displayed: 

1. Text: "Create an MLB.com account to play the game and get access to exclusive MLB content."
2. Email, Nickname, Password, Birthday fields are displayed
3. Sign Up button 
4. Text: "Already have an account? Log In"

custom_steps_separated.content: After filling all fields
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Boilerplate agreement displayed at bottom, containing links to:
- Official Rules
- Terms of Use

And the following privacy policies:
- MLB
- MGM Resorts
- BetMGM

custom_steps_separated.content: Tap on all 5 links and navigate back to app
custom_steps_separated.expected: Each link navigate to the appropriate page

custom_steps_separated.content:
Enter bad info into fields, i.e.:
1. invalid email
2. profanity in the nickname
3. password does not include a caps letter or a number
custom_steps_separated.expected: in line errors are displayed

custom_steps_separated.content: Enter good info into fields
custom_steps_separated.expected: No errors are displayed

custom_steps_separated.content: Tap Log In
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Things are displayed: 

1. Text: "Log in to your MLB.com account to play the game and get access to exclusive MLB content."
2. Email and Password  fields are displayed
3. "Forgot Your Password?"
4. Log In button
5. Text: "Don't have an account? Sign Up"

custom_steps_separated.content: Tap the login link
custom_steps_separated.expected: Login page is displayed

custom_steps_separated.content: Tap sign up link
custom_steps_separated.expected: Sign up page is displayed. No previously entered info retains

custom_steps_separated.content: Tap sign up
custom_steps_separated.expected: Allow notifications dialogue is displayed

custom_steps_separated.content: Select allow
custom_steps_separated.expected: Favorite team selection page is displayed

custom_steps_separated.content: Select a team
custom_steps_separated.expected: Logos and team names are readable and are of uniform size and quality

custom_steps_separated.content: Tap next
custom_steps_separated.expected: Welcome page is displayed, with the same boilerplate agreement and links as listed in step 2.

custom_steps_separated.content: Tap on all 5 links and navigate back to app
custom_steps_separated.expected: Each link navigates to the appropriate page

custom_steps_separated.content: Tap Play
custom_steps_separated.expected: Games list is displayed
User is able to play Rally, but not able to win cash prizes.

custom_steps_separated.content: under 13 y.o.
custom_steps_separated.expected:
User is unable to proceed to the app. 

"You are ineligible to play MLB Rally" message is displayed (in red)

![](index.php?/attachments/get/34128)

There is no option to go back. If user wants to sign up with another DOB, they need to reinstall the app.

custom_steps_separated.content: Open the app and tap on sign up
custom_steps_separated.expected: The sign up page is displayed

custom_steps_separated.content: Fill out the form. The user needs to be 20 years of age with a birthday of tomorrow

A message is displayed stating pay out is not available for users under the age of 21.
"You must be at least 21 years of age to be eligible for prizes. You can still play Rally with the prizing removed." message is displayed (in red)

title: Swipe-to-Type Entry
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user has selected a text entry field
custom_steps: WHEN a user alternately uses swiping and tapping to enter text
custom_expected: THEN the app should enter the text as expected and should not crash

custom_steps_separated.content: If Rally’s notifications are enabled in device settings
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Things are displayed on Notification page: 

- word “Notifications” centered in the header
- picture/icon in the middle of the screen
- below the picture should be the message “Notifications are enabled. You’ll be notified of available games, game results, and your scores.”
- clickable, blue continue button

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. User enables the notifications during Sign Up
2. User Logs In to Rally
custom_steps_separated.expected: ![](index.php?/attachments/get/1709151)

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. User skips 'Skip For Now' during Sign Up
2. User Logs In to Rally
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Things are displayed on Notification page: 

- word “Notifications” centered in the header
- picture/icon in the middle of the screen
- below the picture should be the message “Notifications are disabled.” in red and “Rally uses push notifications to notify you of available games, game results, and your scores.” 
- and there should be a clickable "Enable In Settings" and "Skip For Now" buttons

![](index.php?/attachments/get/34133)

title: Skip For Now link
custom_preconds: Given: User has signed up and is on the "Notifications" screen
custom_steps: When the user taps the "Skip For Now" link
custom_expected: Then the user is redirected to the "Select Your Team" screen

title: Enable Notifications dialogue
custom_preconds: Given: User is viewing the "Notifications" screen
custom_steps: When the user taps the "Enable Notifications" button
custom_expected: Then a dialogue box displays: "MLB Rally" Would Like to Send You Notifications"

title: Allow Notifications
custom_preconds:
Given: User has tapped "Enable Notifications"
And is viewing the Notifications dialogue box
custom_expected: Then the "Select Your Team" screen opens

title: Favorite team page
custom_expected:
1. Team color is the highlight color
2. Selected team has a blue border
3. All teams have logos
4. Teams are displayed in 3 columns and 10 rows
5. The "Next" button is disabled until a user chooses a favorite team

![](index.php?/attachments/get/34145)
![](index.php?/attachments/get/34146)

title: Play button
custom_preconds:
Given: User is on the Welcome screen
And the "Play" button is present and enabled
custom_expected:
Then a new screen opens with text: "Welcome <Nickname> First Time? Tap here to learn how to play Rally."
And the Rally logo displays at top of screen
And today's date displays
And an array of tiles (stack) display showing the
match-ups of today's games

title: Lean how to play Rally
custom_preconds:
Given: User is viewing the screen,
"Welcome <Nickname> First Time?
Tap here to learn how to play Rally."
custom_steps: When the user taps the Welcome message
custom_expected:
Then the "How To Play" screen opens
And "Choose A Game" header displays
And "Select any..." text displays
And five dots are visible at the bottom indicating the screen is the first in a carousel

title: Carousel exit
custom_preconds: Given: User is viewing the last screen of the "How To Play" carousel
custom_steps: When the user taps the "Got It" button
custom_expected:
Then the user is redirected back to the "Welcome <User Nickname> screen and a stack
of today's cards is present under the 'Welcome' message and today's day/date

title: User with DOB 02/29
custom_expected: User is able to sign up with DOB 02/29 and no error message appears.

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. Create Rally profile from MLB profile with DOB 02/29
2. Attempt to login to Rally
custom_steps_separated.expected: Behavior should be the same as for any other user profile with no birth year.

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. Create Rally profile from MLB profile with DOB 02/29 for leap year
2. Attempt to login to Rally
custom_steps_separated.expected: No error appears

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. Create Rally profile from MLB profile with DOB 02/29 for common year
2. Attempt to login to Rally
custom_steps_separated.expected: Error message appers. It takes user to 'Update' page.

custom_steps_separated.content: Pe Eric and Andrew, its okay for app to accept DOB with 02/29 for common years

title: Log In / Sign Up flow
custom_expected:
1. Welcome page with logo and Sign Up / Log In buttons
2. Sign Up or Log In page
3. Welcome page with agreement 
4. Notification page
5. Select Your Team page
6. Game tab opens

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. User is on Sign Up page. 
2. User enters all information 
3. User taps 'Already have an account? Log In"
custom_steps_separated.expected: Log In page is displayed. No previously entered info retains

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. User is on Log In page. 
2. User enters all information 
3. User taps 'Don't have an account? Sign Up"
custom_steps_separated.expected: Sign Up page is displayed. No previously entered info retains

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. User is on Sign Up page. 
2. User enters all information 
3. User clicks back icon and clicks Sign Up again
custom_steps_separated.expected: Sign Up page is displayed. No previously entered info retains

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. User is on Log In page. 
2. User enters all information 
3. User clicks back icon and clicks Log In again
custom_steps_separated.expected: Log In page is displayed. No previously entered info retains
